definition: highly intelligent (idiom)
quick at hearing/wise/clever/sharp-witted/intelligent/acute
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.chinese: 聰明絕頂的完美主義者。

sentences.english: We are both incredibly intelligent people.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是聰明絕頂的人物。

sentences.english: He is handsome, charming, highly intelligent, and a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他英俊迷人，聰明絕頂，是個僞裝高手。

sentences.english: I've seen a lot of very smart people who have lacked these virtues.
sentences.chinese: 我看過很多聰明絕頂的人，但都缺乏這些特質。

sentences.english: This shows he was incredibly intelligent.
sentences.chinese: 那他還真是聰明絕頂啊。

sentences.english: The simple brilliance of the plan filled me with hope.
sentences.chinese: 這個簡單而聰明絕頂的計劃讓我充滿了希望。
